brief_summary.textblock:
This is a multicenter, prospective, randomized, open-label study which compared two
      ventilation modes: spontaneous NAVA mode and spontaneous breathing with IPS mode (the latter
      is considered as the reference ventilatory mode) in patients admitted to the ICU for acute
      respiratory failure and ventilated with an endotracheal tube. NAVA mode allows to minimize
      patient-ventilator disharmony with acceptable tolerance and to preserve spontaneous
      ventilation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing Two Ventilation Modes NAVA (Neurally Adjusted Ventilatory Assist) Mode and Spontaneous Breathing With Inspiratory Pressure Support (IPS) Mode in Consecutive Patients Hospitalized for Acute Respiratory Failure Requiring Mechanical Ventilation With Endotracheal Tube.

facility.name: Groupe Hospitalier Sud - Hôpital Haut-Leveque - Maison du Haut-Leveque
Hopital de la Cote de Nacre - CHU de CAEN

clinical_study.official_title: ZEPHYR: Multicenter, Prospective, Randomized, Open-label Study in Consecutive Patients Hospitalized for Acute Respiratory Failure Requiring Mechanical Ventilation With Endotracheal Tube. This Study Compared Two Ventilation Modes: NAVA Mode and Spontaneous Breathing With Inspiratory Pressure Support (the Latter is Considered as the Reference Ventilation Mode).

other_outcome.measure: Number of implementation failure of the NAVA endotracheal tube.
other_outcome.time_frame: For each patient, the success or failure of the endotracheal tube implementation will be evaluated, this for the entire duration of the study estimated to  18 months

other_outcome.measure: Number and duration of automatic switch into IPS mode
other_outcome.time_frame: Continuous recording until extubation or D14 maximum

other_outcome.measure: Number of Permanent discontinuation of NAVA ventilation mode
other_outcome.time_frame: Continuous recording during the first 48 hours

other_outcome.measure: Comfort of the device measured by a visual analog scale.
other_outcome.time_frame: At the extubation or at D14 maximum

other_outcome.description: Device movements Endotracheal tube obstruction Lesion of the oral or nasal mucosa
other_outcome.measure: Side effects associated with the use of the system
other_outcome.time_frame: Continuous for the duration of ICU stay, an expected maximum of 14 days

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description: The time spent in different modes of spontaneous ventilation (NAVA, IPS) and controlled ventilation (VAC controlled pressure) will be measured. The primary endpoint will be the proportion of patients remaining in spontaneous ventilation after the first 48 hours.
primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the benefit of NAVA mode as compared to IPS mode in terms of duration of spontaneous ventilation 48 hours after inclusion.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous recording during 48 hours following the intubation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction of patient / ventilator disharmony, measured during the first 48 hours with the disharmony index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous recording during the first 48 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Feasibility of the initiation of mechanical ventilation in NAVA mode and feasibility of prolonged mechanical ventilation in NAVA mode
secondary_outcome.measure: Real-time spent in NAVA mode and frequency of returns in a controlled mode (controlled ventilation VAC).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous recording during the first 48 hours
Continuous recording during the first 48 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Total sleep time; Number of arousals per hour; Duration of stage IV sleep ; Duration of Rapid Eye Movement (REM) sleep.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous recording during the first 48 hours

secondary_outcome.description:
Adverse events associated with the use of the device.
Incidence of ventilator-acquired pneumonia.
Duration of ICU stay.
Duration of hospital stay.
Mortality in the ICU.
Hospital mortality.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous for the duration of ICU stay, an expected maximum of 14 days

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
